tit.e: Naramachi (a preservation district of historic buildings in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)
Naramachi (a preservation district of historic buildings in Nara City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 奈良町（ならまち）とは奈良県奈良市の現市街地南に広がる伝統的建造物群保存地区である。
sen.e: Naramachi is a preservation district having groups of historic buildings that extends over the south of the present urban area of Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Naramachi is a preservation district having groups of historic buildings that extends over the south of the present urban area of Nara City, Nara Prefecture.
Naramachi is a preservation district having groups of historic buildings that extends over the south of the present urban area of Nara City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 江戸時代・明治・昭和前期の町屋 (商家)が立ち並ぶ。
sen.e: Streets in this area are lined with machiya (merchant's house) built in the Edo Period, Meiji Era and the early Showa Period.
Streets in this area are lined with machiya (merchant's house) built in the Edo, Meiji, and the early Showa period.
sen.cmt: 半角クォーテーションにし、表現を変えました。
sen.e: Streets in this area are lined with machiya (merchant's house) built in the Edo, Meiji, and the early Showa period.

sen.j: 元々は奈良の都・平城京の外京として多くの社寺が置かれたことに始まる。
sen.e: Naramachi originally developed as an extension of Nara Capital Heijokyo where numerous temples and shrines were located.
Naramachi originally developed as an extension of Nara Capital Heijo-kyo where numerous temples and shrines were located.
Naramachi originally developed as an extension of Nara Capital Heijo-kyo where numerous temples and shrines were located.

sen.j: 長岡京遷都後は衰退の時期もあったが、東大寺や春日大社の門前町としてしだいに活況を見せる。
sen.e: After the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka-kyo, there were times that Naramachi fell into a decline but, subsequently, it gradually became a booming area being the temple town of Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga-Taisha Shrine.

After the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka-kyo, there were times that Naramachi fell into a decline but, subsequently, it gradually became a booming area being the temple town of Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga-Taisha Shrine.

After the transfer of the national capital to Nagaoka-kyo, there were times that Naramachi fell into a decline but, subsequently, it gradually became a booming area being the temple town of Todai-ji Temple and Kasuga-Taisha Shrine.

sen.j: 江戸時代に入り、現在世界遺産に登録されている元興寺境内に様々な産業（筆、墨、蚊帳、晒、布団、刀、酒、醤油等）が発展した。
sen.e: In the Edo Period, various businesses (such as making brushes, ink, bed nets, bleached cotton cloth, futon, swords, sake and soy sauce) developed on the premises of Gango-ji Temple which is now registered as the world heritage.

In the Edo period, various businesses (such as making brushes, ink, mosquito nets, bleached cotton cloth, futon (Japanese-style bedding), swords, sake liquor and soy sauce) developed on the premises of Gango-ji Temple which is now registered as the world heritage.

In the Edo period, various businesses (such as making brushes, ink, mosquito nets, bleached cotton cloth, futon (Japanese-style bedding), swords, sake liquor and soy sauce) developed on the premises of Gango-ji Temple which is now registered as the world heritage.

sen.j: このため江戸期を代表する商工業都市として町が形成された。
sen.e: This area consequently evolved into a city of commerce and industry representative of the Edo Period.
This area consequently evolved into a city of commerce and industry representative of the Edo period.
This area consequently evolved into a city of commerce and industry representative of the Edo period.

sen.j: 遠国奉行による17世紀末の調査では、人口3万5,000人を数えている。
sen.e: According to the survey performed by ongoku-bugyo (the collective name of the magistrates placed at important areas directly controlled by the government in the Edo period) at the end of the 17th century, the population of Naramachi was 35,000.

According to the survey performed by ongoku-bugyo (the collective name of the magistrates placed at important areas directly controlled by the government in the Edo period) at the end of the 17th century, the population of Naramachi was 35,000.

According to the survey performed by ongoku-bugyo (the collective name of the magistrates placed at important areas directly controlled by the government in the Edo period) at the end of the 17th century, the population of Naramachi was 35,000.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦の空襲を免れたことにより戦後は奈良市旧市街地として栄え、1990年4月、奈良市より奈良市都市景観条例に基づき「奈良町都市景観形成地区」（面積約48.1ha）の指定を受ける。
sen.e: Having escaped the air raid during the World War 2, Naramachi flourished as the former urban district of Nara City after the war and, in April 1990, the area was designated as the Naramachi Urban Landscape Formation Area (approximately 48.1ha) in accordance with the Nara City Landscape Conservation Regulation.

Having escaped the air raid during the World War II, Naramachi flourished as the former urban district of Nara City after the war and, in April 1990, the area was designated as 'the Naramachi Urban Landscape Formation Area' (approximately 48.1ha) in accordance with the Nara City Landscape Conservation Regulation.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせ、クォーテーションを補足しました。
sen.e: Having escaped the air raid during the World War II, Naramachi flourished as the former urban district of Nara City after the war and, in April 1990, the area was designated as 'the Naramachi Urban Landscape Formation Area' (approximately 48.1ha) in accordance with the Nara City Landscape Conservation Regulation.

sen.j: 20世紀後半には地域住民による町屋保存活動が活発化し、1984年には社団法人奈良まちづくりセンターを設立。
sen.e: In the latter half of the 20th century, efforts to conserve machiya buildings became active and, in 1984, Nara Machizukuri Center (ＮMＣ)was established.
In the latter half of the 20th century, efforts to conserve machiya buildings became active and, in 1984, Nara Machizukuri Center (NMC) was established.
In the latter half of the 20th century, efforts to conserve machiya buildings became active and, in 1984, Nara Machizukuri Center (NMC) was established.

sen.j: 町屋の原型を保ちつつ現代風に改装された飲食店や雑貨店、公共文化施設、社寺が町内各地に点在するようになる。
sen.e: Restaurants and general stores that were the refurbished machiya to offer modern features while maintaining their original form, public cultural facilities, temples and shrines began to dot various areas of the town.

Restaurants and general stores that were the refurbished machiya to offer modern features while maintaining their original form, public cultural facilities, temples and shrines began to dot various areas of the town.

Restaurants and general stores that were the refurbished machiya to offer modern features while maintaining their original form, public cultural facilities, temples and shrines began to dot various areas of the town.

sen.j: このため奈良の新たな観光スポットとして各方面から注目を集め、細かく入り組んだ路地を歩きながら歴史的風情を楽しむ観光客で賑わっている。
sen.e: Naramachi consequently started to attract attention as a tourist area and, nowadays, its labyrinth of narrow alleys are busy with visitors who enjoy the historical ambience of the town.
Naramachi consequently started to attract attention as a new tourist area in Nara and, nowadays, its labyrinth of narrow alleys are busy with visitors who enjoy the historical ambience of the town.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「奈良の新たな」を補足しました。
sen.e: Naramachi consequently started to attract attention as a new tourist area in Nara and, nowadays, its labyrinth of narrow alleys are busy with visitors who enjoy the historical ambience of the town.

sen.j: 市民主体のまちづくりシンクタンク社団法人の設立は全国でも初めてのことで、各地のまちづくり運動の先鞭をつけた画期的な事例である。
sen.e: The Urban Development Think Tank consisting mainly of the area residents was the first of its kind in Japan, being the groundbreaking case to set a precedent for the subsequent urban development movement in various regions.

The Urban Development Think Tank consisting mainly of the area residents was the first of its kind in Japan, being the groundbreaking case to set a precedent for the subsequent urban development movement in various regions.

The Urban Development Think Tank consisting mainly of the area residents was the first of its kind in Japan, being the groundbreaking case to set a precedent for the subsequent urban development movement in various regions.

sen.j: なお、「奈良町」という行政地名はなく、地区の通称である。
sen.e: 'Naramachi,' incidentally, is a common name of the area and there is no administrative district under that name.
'Naramachi,' incidentally, is a common name of the area and there is no administrative district under that name.
sen.cmt: 半角クォーテーションにしました。
sen.e: 'Naramachi,' incidentally, is a common name of the area and there is no administrative district under that name.

sen.j: 江戸時代からこの地域の住民は早起きだといわれることがある。
sen.e: Since the Edo Period, it has been sometimes said that residents in this area are early risers.
Since the Edo period, it has been sometimes said that residents in this area are early risers.
Since the Edo period, it has been sometimes said that residents in this area are early risers.

sen.j: その理由は当時、家の前で神使とされているシカが死んでいる所を役人に見つかると罪となり、重罪または3文 (通貨単位)の罰金となった。
sen.e: It was based on the background that, back in those days, if a deer, which was regarded as a divine messenger, was found dead in front of someone's house by officials, it constituted an offense whereby they would face a serious charge or be punished by a fine of 3 mon (an old currency unit in Japan).

It was based on the background that, back in those days, if a deer, which was regarded as a divine messenger, was found dead in front of someone's house by officials, it constituted an offense whereby they would face a serious charge or be punished by a fine of three mon (an old currency unit in Japan).
sen.cmt: 半角クォーテーションにし、表記を変えました。
sen.e: It was based on the background that, back in those days, if a deer, which was regarded as a divine messenger, was found dead in front of someone's house by officials, it constituted an offense whereby they would face a serious charge or be punished by a fine of three mon (an old currency unit in Japan).

sen.j: それ故、朝早く起きて役人が見回りに来る前にシカが家の前で死んでいないか確認するようになったという。
sen.e: The area residents consequently came to get up early to check to see if there was no dead deer in front of their houses before the officials began to make the rounds of the town.
The area residents consequently came to get up early to check to see if there was no dead deer in front of their houses before the officials began to make the rounds of the town.
The area residents consequently came to get up early to check to see if there was no dead deer in front of their houses before the officials began to make the rounds of the town.

sen.j: また、その事柄から「早起きは三文の徳」ということわざが生まれたといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that the proverbial phrase saying, 'Early risers stand to gain 3 mon' originated from this matter.
It is said that the proverbial phrase saying, 'Early risers stand to gain three mon' originated from this matter.
sen.cmt: 半角クォーテーションにし、表記を変えました。
sen.e: It is said that the proverbial phrase saying, 'Early risers stand to gain three mon' originated from this matter.

sen.j: 奈良町の魅力は何世代にもわたる住民の生活習慣や文化的伝統が土地柄に染み込み、路地に息づく庶民的な暮らしが現在に継承されている。
sen.e: Attraction of Naramachi is that lifestyle and cultural tradition of its residents have been ingrained in the character of the locality for generations and the livelihood of ordinary people that remain vibrant today.

Attraction of Naramachi is that lifestyle and cultural tradition of its residents have been ingrained in the character of the locality for generations and the livelihood of ordinary people that remain vibrant today.

Attraction of Naramachi is that lifestyle and cultural tradition of its residents have been ingrained in the character of the locality for generations and the livelihood of ordinary people that remain vibrant today.

sen.j: そのため心の奥底に響く味わい深い界隈が多数点在し、その精神が刻み込まれた古いものから感じる落ち着きを好むファン達の根強い人気を集めている。
sen.e: As a result, there are numerous neighborhoods with rich and pleasant ambience which resonates in one's heart whereby attracting the deep-seated popularity of admirers who appreciate the restfulness emanating from the things of the past that were marked with the spirit of the communities of Naramachi.

As a result, there are numerous neighborhoods with rich and pleasant ambience which resonates in one's heart whereby attracting the deep-seated popularity of admirers who appreciate the restfulness emanating from the things of the past that were marked with the spirit of the communities of Naramachi.
sen.cmt: 半角クォーテーションにしました。
sen.e: As a result, there are numerous neighborhoods with rich and pleasant ambience which resonates in one's heart whereby attracting the deep-seated popularity of admirers who appreciate the restfulness emanating from the things of the past that were marked with the spirit of the communities of Naramachi.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道奈 良駅から東へ徒歩15～20分。
sen.e: A 15 to 20 minute walk to east from JR West Nara Station.
15 to 20 minute walk to the east from Nara Station, JR West.
15 to 20 minute walk to the east from Nara Station, JR West.

sen.j: 近鉄奈良駅から南へ徒歩10～15分。
sen.e: A 10 to 15 minute walk to south from Kintetsu Nara Station.
10 to 15 minute walk to the south from Kintetsu Nara Station.
10 to 15 minute walk to the south from Kintetsu Nara Station.

sen.j: 又は各奈良駅より市内循環バス「田中町」か「北京終町」下車北へ。
sen.e: Take the local bus from either of the above-mentioned stations and get off at Tanaka-cho or Kitakyobatecho and head north.
Take the local bus from either of the above-mentioned stations and get off at 'Tanaka-cho' or 'Kitakyobatecho' and head north.
